ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Absolutely! This course taught me so much, both about Nero and about myself. Wonderful course.
I would recommend this course to another student because I found the content interesting and the discussions engaging.

The course does not require a lot of reading but is nevertheless an advanced course, for the expectation is that significant and mature ideas should be developing through class participation, presentations, and the final paper. I recommend this class to a student who is familiar with both Classics and Art Historical methods who is not in the least afraid to voice their opinion of speak in front of a group.

The course provided an introduction to imperial art through the close study of Neronian art and architecture. The focus of the course was developing and producing a research paper based on the student's interest and practicing the presentation of that research.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course was a challenging yet fair introduction to what is expected out of an art historical graduate seminar. I learned a vast amount about a very focused historical period and this pointed analysis surely will help with research and writing going forward in the PhD.
I now feel much more comfortable incorporating material evidence into my research. I feel that I have especially made progress in dealing with the confusing world of numismatics!
